newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia goods/services in surplus in May.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia goods/services in surplus in May.

text.p: Australia's seasonally adjusted balance on goods and services showed a surplus of A$873 million in May compared to April's surplus of A$182 million, the Australian Bureau of Statistics said.
This compares with a seasonally adjusted deficit of A$167 million in May 1996.
Economists' median forecast had been for a surplus of around A$163 million for the balance of goods and services.
EXPORTS: Rural goods 2.010 bln 2.004 bln 1.799 bln
IMPORTS: Consumption goods 1.743 bln 1.788 bln 1.694 bln
Balance of goods/svcs +873 million +182 million -167 million
The Bureau said total exports of goods and services rose five percent, seasonally adjusted, while imports fell three percent.
Exports of goods alone rose six percent, while imports fell one percent.
The trend estimate on the balance of goods and services recorded a surplus of A$233 million in May, the 15th consecutive surplus in this balance.
The bureau said the exports increase was largely attributable to the sale of the ANZAC frigate Te Kaha valued at A$500 million.
